title: Ar deviates from ideal gas at high pressure

content.question: <math alttext="A r gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ar</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> deviates more from ideal behavior at extremely high pressures than <math alttext="N e gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ne</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> does. Which of the following is one reason for this difference?

choices.label: The particle volume of <math alttext="A r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ar</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than that of <math alttext="N e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ne</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="A r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ar</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms have more valence electrons than <math alttext="N e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ne</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms have, so <math alttext="A r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ar</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms have greater interparticle forces.

The intermolecular forces between <math alttext="N e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ne</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms are greater than those between <math alttext="A r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ar</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms.

<math alttext="A r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ar</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms are more attracted to the walls of the container than <math alttext="N e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ne</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms are.

content.answer: The particle volume of <math alttext="A r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ar</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than that of <math alttext="N e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ne</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
